textRegions.text: We’ve seen how to learn representations for single words
How could we learn representations for phrases of arbitrary length?
can we model relationships between words and multiword expressions
can we extract a representation of full sentences that preserves some of its semantic meaning
‘‘ word representations  were learned from a  corpus ’‘
‘‘ we trained word   representations on   a text data set’‘
Idea: recursively merge pairs of word/phrase representations
a model that merges pairs of representations
a model that determines the tree structure
Given two input representations c1 and c2, the recursive network computes the merged representation p as follows:
The network also computes a score s
it estimates the quality of the merge
it will be used to decide which pairs of representations to merge first
The score of the full tree is the sum of all merging scores
The score of the full tree is the sum of all merging scores

Let y be the true parse tree and ŷ be the predicted parse tree
we would like the score s(y) of y to be higher than the score s(ŷ) of ŷ
infer the predicted parse tree ŷ
increase the score s(y) and decrease the score s(ŷ) by doing an update in the direction of the gradient
these gradient can be computed by backpropagating through the recursive network structured according to the parse trees y and ŷ
The nodes of a parse tree are also labeled
can add softmax layer that predict the label from each node representation
this is an additional gradient to backpropagate, for the true parse tree y

word representations are pre-trained using Collobert and Weston’s approach and fine-tuned while training the recursive autoencoder
training is actually based on a margin criteria: s(y) > s(y*) + ∆(y,y*)
score of the true parse tree y trained to be larger than score of any other tree y* plus its number of incorrect spans ∆(y,y*)
a simple modification to the beam search finding the best tree (see Socher et al. for details)

Nearest neighbor phrases based on RNN representation
they allow the extraction of representations for arbitrary length phrases
they can also extract a labeled parse tree for sentences
RNNs can be applied to visual scene segmentation
the span of an internal node in the parse tree defines a region
the label of a node defines its semantic label
